sub_title: Professor of Physical Chemistry of Soft Matter at Radboud University (Nijmegen, NL)
summary: Professor of Physical Chemistry of Soft Matter at the Radboud University in Nijmegen (NL), heading an experimental soft condensed matter group with particular expertise in colloid chemistry and physics, video and confocal microscopy, optical tweezing and image analysis. Studies a wide range of fundamental problems in condensed matter science at the interface of chemistry, physics and materials science by combining colloid chemistry with advanced optical manipulation and imaging techniques. Examples include the development of colloidal bananas, two-dimensional melting, grain boundaries in colloidal crystals, manipulation of interfaces, colloidal liquid crystals and driven colloidal systems. Published over 90 papers and secured competitive funding including ERC Starting and Consolidator Grants. Member of the Liquid Matter Board of the European Physical Society, Fellow of the Royal Society of Chemistry and recepient of the 2019 Corday-Morgan Prize and the 2019 McBain Medal.
